author: Kathryn Folliott
title: Deals to attract Canadians despite low dollar
text:
With the Canadian dollar down, the number of U.S. hotels offering deals to their neighbour to the north will go up, up, up. In Kennebunkport, Maine, the “Oh Canada” promotion applies to mid-week travel (Sunday to Thursday) at four properties: Hidden Pond, The Tides Beach Club, The Lodge on the Cove and the Old Fort Estate at Cape Arundel Inn & Resort. Canadian guests get 20 per cent off room rates for travel Aug. 2 - Sept. 3. Rates must be pre-paid to qualify, and are non-refundable. See the Promotions & Offers link at kennebunkportresortcollection.com.
Save on Mexico, Caribbean travel
Late summer and early fall getaways are on sale with Air Canada Vacations. The “Save the Tax” deal amounts to savings worth up to $350 per couple, for travel Aug. 10 - Oct. 31. Destinations include Mexico, Cuba, Jamaica and the Dominican Republic. In Puerto Plata, the VH Gran Ventana Beach Resort is just down the road from Playa Dorada Golf Course, and guests get discounts on green fees for two or more rounds. Another property, Sandos Caracol Eco Resort in Mexico's Mayan Riviera, offers eco-tours in the jungle. “Save the Tax” bookings must be made by Aug. 2. See aircanadavacations.com.
Dining deals in the Big Easy
COOLinary New Orleans Restaurant Month runs Aug. 1 - 30 with fixed price dining deals at more than 60 restaurants. Lunches go for $20 per person or less (all prices U.S.) and dinners for $39 per person or less. New this year, brunch is on the menu too, for $39 per person or less. Several of the Big Easy's legendary dining venues are taking part, including Arnaud's, Commander's Palace and Antoine's, the oldest French-Creole restaurant in the city and the birthplace of Oysters Rockefeller. See coolinaryneworleans.com.
Park 'n go at New York City hotel
If you're driving to Manhattan for a New York City getaway, the first thing you want to do is park the car and get on with the sightseeing. At The London NYC, parking is on the house. The midtown hotel's “Park & Play” offers free parking for weekend stays, valid Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. Parking normally goes for $58 (all prices U.S.) per night, or up to $68 per night for an SUV. The deals runs through Sept. 7. The London NYC is on West 54th Street near 7th Avenue, five blocks from Central Park. See thelondonnyc.com.
Best buy of the week
Honua Kai Resort in Maui is making the most of a construction site next door with a “Hard Hat Rate”. Room rates have been discounted by 40 per cent for any one-, two- or three-bedroom suite that looks out to the neighbouring construction site, where a new hotel is in the works. The discounted rates are available on travel through the end of this year. Hard Hat Rates booked by Sept. 1 qualify for a “Keiki Hard Hat” package including a construction-themed gift for kids. See the Packages link at honuakai.com.
Kathryn Folliott is a Toronto-based freelance writer. Prices Quote: d are subject to change and availability. Follow @KathrynFolliott.
